description: At the Newark campus of Rutgers University, a surviving island in a sea of broken buildings, fenced parking lots and streets evacuated at nightfall, a group of Puerto Rican writers met last week to explore a rich and diverse body of work that has been largely ignored in the United States and in Latin America.

title: Allied Stores Suit
description: The Federal Government charged in a civil complaint in Manhattan Friday that the Allied Stores Corporation had violated regulations governing the rejection of credit-card applications from consumers.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''Accordingly, we leave it to the P.L.O. and to the Palestinian people to choose the ways and means for the salvation of themselves and their land, and for the realization of their declared aims in the manner they see fit.'' - The Jordanian Cabinet. (A1:6.)

title: PIRATES (5-0) RALLY TO DEFEAT ASTROS, 10-8
description: The Pittsburgh Pirates, overcoming a fiverun deficit, defeated the Houston Astros, 10-8, today to remain unbeaten.

title: ISLANDERS ELIMINATE CAPITALS
description: Other teams may have similar attributes, with good goaltending, strong defense and balanced scoring, but the Islanders have Mike Bossy.

title: Sheila on a Roll
description: After whirlwind stops in Austin, Tex.; Milwaukee, Detroit, Indianapolis and New York, all in three days last week, Sheila Young Ochowicz wasn't even breathing hard. The travels, on which she takes her 5-year-old daughter, Katie, are part of a pattern that will later include Europe, Colorado and who knows where else? Home in Pewaukee, Wis., is only a convenience stop.

title: Police Shooting Brings Disturbance in Alabama
description: A crowd of angry blacks threw stones, bottles and bricks at police cars, witnesses said, after a plainclothes police officer shot a fleeing black man.

title: A Place for Alex Rose
description: Since Alex Rose, the long-time Liberal Party leader, died in 1976, Mayor Koch has been at war with the party.

title: News Summary; MONDAY, APRIL 11, 1983
description: International

title: MDS, Ztel and Wiltek Shuffle Top Executives
description: Top management at three communications companies was shuffled recently with the departure of Peter S. Anderson, 40, from the presidency of the MDS Systems division of the Mohawk Data Sciences Corporation in Parsippany, N.J.

title: News Analysis
description: The assassination of Dr. Issam Sartawi, the Palestine Liberation Organization's leading advocate of recognition of Israel, appears to have been a direct and precisely timed blow at Yasir Arafat as well, according to diplomats here.

title: Noles Is Arrested
description: Dickie Noles, the Chicago Cubs pitcher, was arrested late Saturday night and charged with assault, disorderly conduct while intoxicated and resisting arrest following an incident outside a Cincinnati bar.

title: YANKESS TOP BLUE JAYS, 3-0
description: Shane Rawley was the perfect antidote for what ailed Billy Martin today. What ailed the Yankee manager today? Yesterday.

title: JOYS OF SURF FISHING
description: SURF fishing's devotees are as passionate about their sport as the most dedicated dry fly fisherman on a hallowed Catskill trout stream. By the first week in May, the surf fishermen will begin to appear on Northeast beaches that were empty all winter save for gulls.

title: USA TODAY'S FAST GAINS RAISE BOTH HOPES AND DOUBTS
description: USA Today, started by the Gannett Company last September as ''the nation's newspaper,'' has jumped off to a fast start. Last month it counted more than 800,000 daily copies sold in 14 metropolitan areas, making it the country's sixth largest selling newspaper.

title: Weight Suspected In Fatal Air Crash
description: Bad weather and an overloaded plane may have been responsible for the crash that killed six people in Allegany County, officials said.

title: Venezuela's Oil Prices
description: Venezuela, encouraged by an apparent stabilization in the oil market, has raised some oil product prices by between 30 cents and $3.50 a barrel, the Energy and Mines Minister, Humberto Calderon Berti, said today. Last month, the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries cut the reference price to $29, from $34.

title: Merrill Lynch Offshore Notes
description: Merrill Lynch & Company announced yesterday that its Netherlands Antilles subsidiary planned to issue $150 million of 10 5/8 percent notes due in 1990 at a price of 100.

title: Canadians Lower Gas Price 11%; Market Loss In U.S. a Factor
description: The Canadian Government said today that it is slashing the price of the natural gas it sells to the United States by 11 percent, to $4.40 (United States) from $4.94 for a thousand cubic feet.

title: Lloyd's Issues New Rules
description: Leaders of Lloyd's of London, the multicompany British insurance market, adopted regulations today that require underwriters to disclose detailed information on reinsurance contracts and recoveries made on such contracts.

title: Arab Windshields Smashed
description: Dozens of Arab-owned cars parked near the Jewish township of Qiryat Arba in the Israeli-occupied West Bank were damaged overnight, the Israel radio reported today. The police said they had received 33 complaints from Arab residents whose car windshields were smashed. Qiryat Arba, built near thePalestinian town of Hebron, has been a frequent site of clashes between Jews and Arabs.

title: Bank Customers Get An Eyeful of Elegant Dogs
description: Tall, dark and leggy, Champion Kabiks has sleek brown hair with blond highlights that is washed every four days, given a cream rinse, and blow-dried for two hours.

title: NEOMAR RESOURCES LTD reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: Christine
description: APOSSESSED car? An insanely angry 1958 Plymouth Fury named Christine that drives itself around attacking people? This time Stephen King has gone too far, I said to myself as I began to catch the drift of his eighth and latest horror novel, ''Christine.'' This time he's not going to get me the way he did in ''The Shining,'' ''The Stand,'' ''Cujo'' and his other maniacal stories. This time he's just going to leave me cold.

title: NATIONAL STATE BANK (ELIZABETH, NJ) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
RIGHTS UNIT WILL SUBPOENA PAPERS FROM TWO AGENCIES
description: The United States Commission on Civil Rights voted today to issue subpoenas to the Labor Department and the Education Department to obtain documents for an investigation of civil rights enforcement by the Reagan Administration.

title: A.M.C. Adds To New Shares
description: The American Motors Corporation announced that strong interest in its proposed stock offering had prompted the auto maker to increase the number of new shares to be sold by 65 percent, to 24.78 million shares, from 15 million.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Air Products and Chemicals Inc., Allentown, Pa., said its Catalytic Inc. unit had received a contract from Schering-Plough Corp. to design a commercial plant to produce interferon using recombinant DNA technology; terms of the contract were not disclosed.

title: MUSICAL SOFTWARE: POINT AND COUNTERPOINT
description: MY musical taste is admittedly old-fashioned, having only recently progressed to the point where I will intentionally listen to something as modern as the compositions of Leos Janacek. This leaves me in somewhat of a quandary when it comes to performing computers.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: ARE all those people wandering through the shops in the Trump Tower really tourists? Or do they just look like visitors to an alien land? Their necks are craned, their eyes wide to see what's around that corner or on the next level. Mostly they find signs telling them what stores are yet to open: Martha, Buccellati, DDL Foodshow. The dozen or so boutiques that are already there are a varied lot with one common denominator: moderately high to stratospheric prices.

title: BULL & BEAR GROUP INC reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: RIGGS NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
British Official Makes Detour To Meet With Hussein Today
description: Foreign Secretary Francis Pym will discuss Middle East peace efforts with King Hussein of Jordan in Amman on Tuesday, the British Foreign Office said today.

title: A.T.& T. TO TRY DISCOUNT RATE PLAN
description: The Federal Communications Commission today approved a request by the American Telephone and Telegraph Company to offer special discounted flexible-rate long-distance service to some customers in three states as an experiment. The plan would make the company more competitive with other companies specializing in longdistance services.

title: Eritrean Guerrillas Announce Attacks on Ethiopian Forces
description: The Eritrean People's Liberation Front, fighting for independence from Ethiopia, said today that it had begun a major offensive against Ethiopian forces.

title: CAMBODIAN TROOPS ACCUSED OF GRENADE ATTACKS ON REFUGEES
description: Cambodians who witnessed a Vietnamese attack on a border settlement last week say Cambodian soldiers as well as Vietnamese threw hand grenades into bunkers containing women and children.

title: 92 SCHOOLS THAT ARE OVERCOMING URBAN OBSTACLES
description: TWO high schools in 20 of the nation's largest cities will be cited today for pointing the way toward excellence under adverse urban conditions. Each school will receive a $1,000 award, and about half of them will receive $20,000 grants to encourage them to improve on what they are already doing well.

title: SOCIOLOGIST SAYS CONVERTS OUTPACE INTERMARRIAGES IN JUDAISM
description: A Brooklyn sociologist says Jews should not be overly concerned about the rate of intermarriage between Jews and non-Jews because the rate of conversion to Judaism had increased 300 percent in the last 30 years.

title: BALLESTEROS SHOOTS 69 FOR 280 TO WIN MASTERS BY FOUR
description: Seve Ballesteros of Spain tore into the first four holes of the Augusta National Golf Club, making a birdie, an eagle, a par and another birdie, and easily won the Masters Tournament today for the second time in four years.

title: HOLOCAUST SURVIVORS, IN U.S. REUNION, ASK WORLD TO REMEMBER
description: Some were searching for a brother or a sister. Others were trying to find more distant relatives or old friends. But many who came to the reunion of survivors of Nazi Germany's concentration camps were just searching.

title: Wranglers Win On 98-Yard Score
description: Alan Risher's third touchdown pass of the game, a 98-yarder to Jackie Flowers, lifted the Arizona Wranglers to a 22-21 United States Football League victory over the Washington Federals tonight.

title: BINKS MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
CENTRAL CAROLINA BANK & TRUST CO reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
ANGER VOICED AT RED-LIGHT VIOLATORS
description: If a taxi driver goes through a red light and Dr. William R. Brown is in the back seat of the cab, the doctor takes his own stand against what he sees as lawlessness on the city streets. He does not tip.

title: Comings and Goings
description: Bruce Parkhill, who spent six years as basketball coach at William and Mary, is moving to Penn State, replacing Coach Dick Harter, who resigned last month. ... Walter Alston, the former Los Angeles Dodgers' manager who is recovering from a heart attack, has been moved out of the intensive care unit at Deaconess Hospital in Cincinnati. ... Tom Sheehey of McQuaid Jesuit High School in Rochester, one of the nation's top high school players, chose to attendVirginia. ... In Eugene, Ore., Mary Decker Tabb, the world record-holding middle distance runner, was treated for neck pains at a hospital after a car in which she was a passenger collided with a milk truck.

title: UNION NATIONAL CORP (MT LEBANON, PA) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
MX, THE DANGER
description: The Commission on Strategic Forces, the panel of experts that the President appointed a few months ago to tell him how to base the MX missile, has recommended placing 100 of the controversial weapons in existing but reinforced Minuteman silos. This proposal would initiate a dangerous and costly spiral of the arms race that must be opposed.

title: BILL SIGNED TO UPGRADE JERSEY PRISONS
description: Governor Kean signed a bill today to appropriate $80 million for prison construction and improvements at 10 county jails to relieve overcrowding.

title: FIDELITY OF OKLAHOMA INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
GULF CLASHES IMPERIL OIL SPILL CLEANUP
description: Renewed fighting between Iraq and Iran presented new obstacles today to efforts by Persian Gulf countries to obtain a cease-fire so that an Iranian oil spill threatening their coastlines can be capped.

title: THE GOOD TACO CORPORATION reports earnings for year to March 7.
KICKOFF VOLUNTEERS AT A&M
description: As the Texas A&M football team runs through its spring drills on a warm, windy afternoon, a frail-looking defensive back comes trotting off the artificial turf after being knocked to the ground by a 230-pound running back.

title: Reliance Group
description: Reliance Group Inc., the closely held insurance and financial conglomerate of Saul P. Steinberg and his family, announced it had signed a letter of intent to buy almost 11,000 apartments in Toronto from Saudi Arabian investors for about $500 million. Reliance said the sale was conditional on refinancing debt in the apartments and on approval by the Ontario government for ''orderly'' rent increases.

title: Creditors Balk On Braniff Plan
description: Major creditors of the Braniff International Corporation are balking at the operating plan that has been proposed by the Hyatt Corporation, complaining that the Chicago-based hotel chain wants too much of the airline for too little financial commitment, sources close to the deal said.

title: Bridge: Strong New Zealand Team Keeps Backers in Suspense
description: About 100 local supporters were sitting tensely before a Vu-Graph at 10 o'clock here Sunday night, for a quartet of Christchurch players with considerable international experience seemed poised to pin a first defeat on Kathie Wei's Precision team of New York experts.

title: CLARK'S SURGEON WAS 'WORRIED TO DEATH'
description: A gas station attendant called Dr. William C. DeVries, the surgeon who had implanted an artificial heart in Dr. Barney B. Clark, and said, ''Doctor, someone doesn't like you very much.''

title: Dome Reorganizes Cyprus Holdings
description: Dome Petroleum Ltd. said it had reorganized its holdings in the Cyprus Anvil Mining Corporation to insulate Cyprus's financial affairs from Dome's.

title: C.I.A. Calls Off Visit to Columbia
description: The Central Intelligence Agency canceled a recruiting drive at Columbia University yesterday because of the threat of a student demonstration.

title: Marriott Net Up 13.6%
description: The Marriott Corporation had a net income of $19.2 million for the first quarter of this year, up 13.6 percent from $16.9 million a year ago, the company said today.

title: RESTRAINT IS A KEY TO SPECIAL MASTERS
description: Sports has always been a directors' medium on television. In contrast to studio shows or situation comedies, where production, packaging and writing are essential elements, the picture is the story in sports.

title: HELENE CURTIS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
BARNETT BANKS OF FLORIDA INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
News Summary; TUESDAY, APRIL 12, 1983
description: International

title: FRIGITRONICS INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
AFG INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
NIAGARA SHARE CORP reports earnings for As of March 31.
description: Asset figures represent net assets.

title: SANTA MONICA BANK (CALIF) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Stearns Returns, May Catch Soon
description: John Stearns, missing from the lineup since last Aug. 12, will leave the disabled list today and rejoin the Mets as they open a six-game trip to Philadelphia and St. Louis. And, Stearns says, he will return not only with a healthier right elbow but with a sounder view of what it takes to stay in the big leagues.

title: Accounts
description: * Totes Inc., Cincinnati, has named Fahlgren & Ferriss to handle two new product assignments, one of which is a new dress/casual sock called ''soft sole.''

title: DIGITAL RECORDING CORP reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
BANCO DE PONCE reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Commodore Aims At Video Games
description: The home computer industry entered another flurry of price-cutting yesterday, as Commodore International appeared to take its first shot at the home video game industry.

title: U.N. Official Confers On Afghan Fighting
description: The United Nations efforts to find a solution to the Afghan conflict were resumed here today when Under Secretary General Diego Cordovez met separately with the Foreign Ministers of Pakistan and Afghanistan.

title: CORVUS SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
Market Place; Kodak Stock Under Stress
description: THE stock of the Eastman Kodak Company, the photographic colossus that is a recurring favorite in Wall Street, has come under pressure lately. And some analysts have lowered their earnings forecasts for 1983.

title: BOURNE'S SCORING GIVES ISLANDERS LIFT
description: Bob Bourne, the New York Islanders' veteran left wing, provided the self-analysis. He agreed that he was a different player at this time of year.

title: New York Sports Plans Autumn Premiere
description: Stephen Hanks and Beatrice Jones met at Sport magazine, fell in love and were married.

title: BTR in Bid For Control Of Tilling;
description: BTR P.L.C. an energy and engineering conglomerate, began a $900 million bid for a diversified industrial group, Thomas Tilling P.L.C., in one of the biggest takeover battles ever in London.

title: DUCOMMUN INC reports earnings for qtr to April 1.
description: b-After a loss of $287,000 from discontinued operations. c-Including income from discontinued operations of $321,000.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: GRADING THE SCHOOLS
description: Eva Rabinowitz, a teacher of handicapped children at Christopher Columbus High School in the Bronx, is in her middle 50's, a product of the time when able women graduating from college were discouraged from pursuing most careers except teaching. Her daughter, Linda Rabinowitz, who is 27, also enjoys working with children. But she is a doctor, a pediatric intern at Yale-New Haven Medical Center.

title: OIL PRICE CUTS ACCEPTED, BRITISH SAY
description: The British National Oil Corporation reported today that an overwhelming majority of its customers and suppliers had accepted its proposed price cuts for North Sea crude oil.

title: A WITHHOLDING LAW VS. CREDIT UNION MEMBERS
description: To the Editor:

title: FIRST BANKERS CORP OF FLORIDA reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After securities losses of $940,000 and an extraordinary credit of $119,000.

title: APPLIED POWER INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
description: b-Net income.

title: The Carrys
description: An alliance of civic, business and educational organizations is seeking to interest more New York City families in the public school system.

title: SOUTHERN BANCORPORATION reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
INJURIES UNSETTLED YANKEES
description: Billy's back - but who's on first? Or at short? Or in right? The answers will unfold today, shortly after Joe DiMaggio throws out the first ball to celebrate the 60th anniversary of Yankee Stadium.

title: CUOMO BACKS JURY SELECTION BY JUDGES
description: Governor Cuomo and legislators of both parties said today that they would support an experiment to test the effect of letting judges, instead of lawyers, select juries in state courts.

title: Chess: Huebner Wins and Evens His Match With Smyslov
description: Robert Huebner of West Germany got a late reprieve by winning the ninth game of his quarterfinal match for world championship candidates in Velden, Austria, with Vasily Smyslov of the Soviet Union. Their series now stands even at 4 1/2-4 1/2, with one game to be played before tie-breaking rules take effect.

title: DOW UP BY 17.12, TO 1,141.83
description: Stock market prices advanced sharply yesterday, with the blue-chip, technology and energy issues leading the upswing. The market's advance was attributed in part to a drop in interest rates yesterday for government securities, and a decline of nearly a quarter of a percentage point in the key Federal funds rate for overnight loans among banks.

title: Moscow Says Hussein Wrecked Reagan Plan
description: The Soviet Union said today that Jordan's refusal to enter American-sponsored talks with Israel had wrecked President Reagan's Middle East peace plan.

title: WEIS MARKETS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 26.
description: Share earnings reflect two 3-for-2 stock splits paid in May 1982 and February 1983.

title: MUSE AIR CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
INDUSTRIAL FLIGHT FROM NORTH
description: Over the past two years, the number of companies moving their plants from Minnesota to other states or abroad reached a record high. And to the surprise of many people here, most of those relocating were young, expanding companies, not the old, declining industries that have been associated with cities in the North.

title: FIRST CHICAGO CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
ARIZONA BANCWEST CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BANKS' DRIVE TO ENTER FLORIDA
description: Some of the nation's largest banks are mounting a big lobbying effort here in an effort to mine the nearly $50 billion on deposit in Florida banks.

title: French and Chinese Discuss Nuclear Plant
description: A visit to France by China's Minister for Foreign Trade and Foreign Economic Relations has raised French hopes of a major stake in the construction of China's first nuclear power station, a Government source said today.

title: Inquiry on Steinbrenner
description: Unfavorable comments that George Steinbrenner made about National League umpires more than two weeks ago have led to an investigation by the office of Commissioner Bowie Kuhn. It was undertaken at the request of the umpires' union leader and Chub Feeney, the National League president, who yesterday called the comments ''asinine.''

title: VOTING FOR NEW FACES
description: A new Schools Chancellor has been chosen amid rhetoric that tells us only that this city is getting failing grades in racial coexistence.

title: CYMATICOLOR CORP reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: HOLES IN SHELTER
description: It was one of those sophisticated real estate tax shelters, and among the more than 200 investors who sank more than $5 million into the scheme were three professional hockey players, including Ron Greschner of the Rangers.

title: Fans, Get Ready: Another League
description: Another professional football league was born yesterday, with several new twists. It plans to play from July to October, starting this year.

title: CATHERINE BASIE
description: Catherine Basie, wife of Count Basie, the jazz musician and band leader, died of a heart attack yesterday at the couple's home in Freeport, Grand Bahama Island, according to Mr. Basie's agent.

title: Ohio Broker Pleads Guilty
description: The former managing partner of a nowdefunct Toledo brokerage firm has pleaded guilty to a five-count indictment charging him with violating Federal securities laws.

title: Ruling Backs Fees Paid To Legal Service Board
description: The General Accounting Office has issued an interim opinion upholding in principle the legality of the consulting fees that President Reagan's former appointees to the Legal Services Corporation's board paid themselves last year.

title: Initial Stock Offerings Set Record in Quarter
description: A record for equity financings was set in the first quarter by companies selling stock publicly for the first time, a tally by Abrahamsen & Company showed yesterday.

title: FILM: GREEK 'THIASSOS'
description: ''O Thiassos'' (The Traveling Players) was shown as part of the 1976 New Directors/New Films series at the Museum of Modern Art. Following are excerpts from a review that appeared in The New York Times of April 10, 1976. The film opens today at the Public Theater.

title: WHEN DIVORCE PAYMENTS LAG
description: A new program intended to guarantee the flow of child-support or alimony payments in the event of default is to be offered soon by the Republic Insurance Group of Dallas. Spokesmen for the insurance industry say the program, which is described as an insurance policy though it is actually a loan arrangement, is the first of its type.

title: Museum Gets a Home
description: The New Museum, for five years squished into a corner of the New School's Graduate Center at 65 Fifth Avenue, is finally getting a permanent home. To celebrate, and to plan a benefit on April 28, a group of supporters gathered the other evening in the sleek Seventh Avenue showroom of the designer Mary McFadden.

title: Advertising; Thompson Controls Criticized
description: MARIE LUISI, who a year ago was blamed by the JWT Group for the computer manipulation that led to a $30 million write off by the group, has charged in legal papers that inept JWT financial controls were responsible for the problems.

title: Ex-Mayor Pledges His House for Bail
description: A Federal judge today ordered a former Mayor of Weehawken to put up his $100,000 home as collateral instead of posting cash bail while awaiting trial in an extortion case.

title: SYMPOSIUM OF 300 SCIENTISTS WILL LOOK AT NEWEST WORK
description: The symposium honoring the 30th anniversary of the discovery of the double helix will be held here at the science-oriented Churchill College, organized in 1960 and therefore one of the youngest parts of Cambridge University, an institution whose origins lie in the 13th century.

title: FOUR UNDER THROUGH FOUR
description: On the scoreboards all over Augusta National, the red numbers denoting how many strokes a golfer is under par for the tournament went up quickly next to Seve Ballesteros's name a 6 after a birdie at the first hole, an 8 after an eagle at the second hole, a 9 after another birdie at the fourth hole. In his swashbuckling style, the 26-year-old Spanish conquistador had snatched the lead in the Masters so quickly, the other contenders were almost physically stunned.

title: DANCE: TAYLOR COMPANY
description: T.S. ELIOT is said to have remarked that whereas minor poets borrow, great poets steal. Whoever did say that, it happens to be true, and it applies to all the arts. Great artists can appropriate many different styles and themes and make them entirely their own. In contrast, the efforts of lesser artists are simply reminders of the greater artists to whom they are indebted.

title: Aer Lingus-Dunfey Post
description: Jon Canas, president of Dunfey Hotels, has been named chief executive of the Aer Lingus-Dunfey Corporation. He succeeds John P. Dunfey, founder of the hotel chain now owned by Aer Lingus, the Irish national airline.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''It has to be told, it has to be relived so it won't be repeated.

title: The Sun Looked Good Even With Sound Effects
description: With a pale and fitful sun suggesting spring - again - scores of people sat by the waterfall in Paley Park on West 53d Street during yesterday's midday hours. Surrounded by two dozen planters of golden yellow tulips, they drank coffee, ate lunches, talked or read.

title: General Who Led Argentina In Falkland War Is Detained
description: Gen. Leopoldo Galtieri, the former army commander and President who was dismissed after Argentina's defeat in the Falkland war, has been placed under detention for 60 days, the official Telam press agency said today.

title: State Energy Issue Is Priced at 99 1/4
description: A $75 million issue of 9 1/8 percent bonds of the New York State Energy Research and Development Corporation was tentatively priced at 99 1/4 to yield 9.19 percent to maturity in 2013 by underwriters led by the Merrill Lynch White Weld Capital Markets Group.

title: Salvadorans Seize 2 Officers In Massacre and Kidnapping
description: The Defense Ministry said today that it had put two officers under house arrest in connection with a recent massacre and a kidnapping.

title: 'Gala' Night With the Lazars Charlotte Curtis
description: IRVING PAUL (SWIFTY) LAZAR is the Superagent who makes milliondollar book and movie deals, and when he and his wife, Mary, are in town, they often gather up their rich, elegant and accomplished friends and indulge them in something more than a quiet little dinner, and they were at it again the other night.

title: Parking Lot Link Focus of CBS Trial
description: The prosecutor at the murder trial of Donald Nash introduced records yesterday in an attempt to show that Mr. Nash had used a Hudson River parking lot where four people were killed last April 12.

title: KNICKS WIN TO AID PLAYOFF PROSPECTS
description: Rory Sparrow and Paul Westphal threw pinpoint passes that Bernard King and Bill Cartwright consistently turned into baskets last night as the Knicks overwhelmed the Indiana Pacers, 121-92, at Madison Square Garden.

title: A Worthy but Tragic Failure
description: President Reagan's failure to bring Jordan to negotiations with Israel is no disgrace. But it is a failure that needs to be properly understood.

title: Man Shot to Death In Dispute in Store
description: A 24-year-old Brooklyn man was shot to death yesterday when a dispute with the owner of a Brooklyn clothing store erupted into violence, the police said.

title: 2 IN U.S. SEEK SOTHEBY'S
description: Two young American businessmen bid almost $100 million today for Sotheby Parke Bernet, the venerable auction house, opening what promises to be a long and bitter takeover battle of a kind seldom seen in the discreet and fastidious world of art.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt Issues

title: How Not to Conduct a Strike
description: Five weeks have passed since striking conductors shut down the Metro-North Railroad. Is there any reason to hope it will be running five weeks from now? Not much, unless politicians and labor leaders make a stand against the conductors' irrational demands. Negotiations have stalled on the question of crew size. The union wants to specify the number of conductors on each train. The M.T.A. insists that it alone should make such decisions.

title: Unarmed B-52 With 7 Aboard Missing on Training Mission
description: An unarmed B-52 bomber assigned to the 19th Bombardment Wing at Robins Air Force Base was reported missing today with seven people aboard while on a training mission in Nevada, the Air Force said.

title: NATIONAL CITY CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Topics; Aprilled; On Bringing Your Mitt
description: About lunchtime today, some number of young New Yorkers will be subjected to a stern quiz. ''You say you have to go to your grandmother's funeral?'' the teacher will ask skeptically before adding, with a wink: ''So why are you taking your mitt?''

title: Computer Magazine For the Nontechnical
description: A much hotter publishing arena than sports these days is the computer, and into that hot spot is leaping a company named Micro Discovery of Los Alamitos, Calif., with Micro Digest, a magazine for the personal computer owner that, believe it or not, is being written so it can be understood by the nontechnical. That promise is also the subtitle, ''The nontechnical magazine of personal computing.''

title: FOREST CITY ENTERPRISES INC reports earnings for qtr to Jan 31.
description: b-Including special credits of $2,154,000 for the quarter and $5,550,000 for the year. c-Net loss including special credits of $672,000 for the quarter and $1,087,000 for the year.

title: U.S. Denies Charges By China on Defector
description: The State Department denied Chinese allegations Monday that President Reagan ''seized away'' the Chinese tennis player Hu Na, who was granted political asylum last week over Peking's protests.

title: CHICAGO TO ELECT NEW MAYOR TODAY
description: Two men, both considered political longshots just 60 days ago, ended their bitter election campaigns today to become mayor of the nation's second-largest city.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of a mechanical error, the Sky Watch map on Sunday depicted the night sky for the week just ended rather than the coming one. The correct map appears today on page C8.

title: Noles Pleads in Court, Then Is Routed by Reds
description: Dickie Noles, the Chicago Cub pitcher, pleaded not guilty early today on three charges stemming from a brawl that took place at a Cincinnati bar last Saturday night.

title: RIO ALTO EXPLORATION LTD reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Net loss

title: Tandem Develops Fiber-Optic Link
description: Tandem Computers Inc., Cupertino, Calif., announced a new fiberoptic link that permits the connection of as many as 14 Tandem systems, up to half a mile apart, into a high-speed network.

title: U.S. Accuses 4 of Real Estate Fraud
description: A Federal grand jury today indicted four men accused of mail, securities and tax frauds that the indictment says cost some 250 investors more than $5 million.

title: APPLIED DATA RESEARCH INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Year-ago share earnings have been restated to reflect a 5 percent stock dividend declared in May 1982 and a 2-for-1 stock split declared in March 1983.

title: GALAXY OIL CO reports earnings for qtr to Dec 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: NAKASONE PARTY WINS LOCAL VOTE
description: The governing Liberal Democratic Party of Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone won sweeping victories in nationwide local elections Sunday, keeping control of all but 2 out of 13 major governorships contested.

title: Death Penalty Upheld In Slaying of Reporter
description: The Arizona Supreme Court today upheld the conviction and death sentence of John Harvey Adamson for the June 1976 slaying of an Arizona Republic reporter.

title: News Analysis
description: The report of the Presidential Commission on Strategic Forces virtually repeals six years of dogma about the growing vulnerability of fixed land-based missiles to a Soviet attack and the consequent doubts about American nuclear deterrent power.

title: Beatrice Foods
description: The Beatrice Foods Company announced it had acquired the equivalent of 31.4 percent of the Towle Manufacturing Company's series A preferred shares in consideration for two divisions it had sold Towle. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Beatrice said it held 8,828 shares of Towle's series B preferred stock, which is convertible into the equivalent of 353,120 series A shares. The company said it was holding the stock for investment purposes, and that it had agreed not to own or control more than 9.9 percent of Towle's outstanding voting securities.

title: HUSSEIN BELIEVES SEARCH FOR PEACE IS AT A DEAD END
description: President Reagan and his top aides are insisting that the Middle East initiative is wounded, perhaps, but not dead. But Israeli officials feel the Begin Government has been let off the hook. News analysis, page A14.

title: MISS STREEP, KINGSLEY, GOSSETT AND MISS LANGE WIN OSCARS
description: As far as Julie Sullivan was concerned, as she alternately swooned and shivered while watching the greats of Hollywood's entertainment industry file into the Dorothy Chandler Pavilion tonight, the California license plate in her hand told her whole story: 1ONJFAN.

title: Playboy Guides To Be in Magazine
description: Playboy magazine announced yesterday that the Playboy Guides that have been appearing as independent publications will be included in Playboy itself as editorial features from now on.

title: UNITED STATES TRUCK LINES INC OF DELAWARE reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
EX-EMIGRE PUT ON TRIAL IN POLAND
description: A Solidarity leader active in emigre circles went before a military court in the city of Bydgoszcz today, charged with trying to overthrow the Communist system.

title: MAN QUESTIONED IN SLAYING OF P.L.O. OFFICIAL
description: The Portuguese police continued today to question a young man with a Moroccan passport in connection with the slaying Sunday of Dr. Issam Sartawi, an official of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: FOURTH FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
CORRECTION
description: A Washington dispatch on March 30 about Yuri V. Andropov's health incorrectly described his meetings on March 25. The only foreign leader he met that day was Daniel Ortega Saavedra, head of the Nicaraguan junta.

title: A Top Aide Will Retire At Alexander Howden
description: Michael J.A. Glover, the 53-year-old vice chairman and chief operating officer of the Alexander Howden Group of London, has announced that he will take early retirement, the parent company, Alexander & Alexander Services Inc., said yesterday in New York.

title: MAN AND THE LAWN - A LONG LOVE STORY
description: BENEATH the surface of the seemingly tranquil lawns that are turning green in the suburbs of America, lies one of nature's most dynamic energy factories. And scientists are now learning that it plays a far more important esthetic role in the lives of their owners than they had thought.

title: 2 LEGISLATORS SAY U.S. BREAKS LAW IN AIDING ANTI-SANDINISTS
description: Two United States Congressmen said today after a four-day trip to Nicaragua and Honduras that they are convinced the Reagan Administration is actively supporting anti-Sandinist insurgents in violation of Federal law.

title: Key Rates
description: * Maximum rateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: UNIVERSITY FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN (FLA) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss. Universal Federal converted to a public company in October 1982.

title: COMPUTER DEVICES INC reports earnings for qtr to Dec 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: BY SALLY BEDELL
description: Next week, Walt Disney Productions will stop wishing upon a star and begin wishing upon a satellite. On April 18 the company that made its name on wholesome films, prime-time series and theme parks will test the allure of its cleancut philosophy in a new arena, cable television, with the Disney Channel. The channel, a 16-hour-a-day collection of Disney classics such as ''Dumbo'' and $45 million worth of new programs, will be beamed by satellite to cable subscribers around the country.

title: INTEREST RATES MOVE LOWER
description: Interest rates declined for short-and long-term Treasury securities yesterday as traders grew more confident that the Federal Reserve was not trying to push short-term rates higher.

title: MX. THE DETERRENT
description: The underlying premise of the report issued by the bipartisan President's Commission on Strategic Forces is that there may be a better way to stabilize deterrence and reduce the risk of war - better, that is, than the course we have followed for a decade.

title: SPORTS PEOPLE;
description: The way Minnesota officials are telling it, at the time they dropped Pete Redfern on March 25 he was an essentially healthy righthander who just didn't measure up to the Twins' pitching standards for this season.

title: FIRST BLACK NAMED TO VIRGINIA COURT
description: Gov. Charles S. Robb today appointed the first black justice to the Virginia Supreme Court, saying he wished to give the all-male, all-white court ''a new dimension'' that would reflect ''the aspirations and ideals of a wide range of Virginians.''

title: The Gianinos
description: An alliance of civic, business and educational organizations is seeking to interest more New York City families in the public school system.

title: COMPUTER DATA SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $20,600 for the quarter and $47,500 for the 9 months. c-Including income from discontinued operations of $17,900 for the quarter and $37,600 for the 9 months.

title: News Analysis
description: An air of uncertainty has enveloped President Reagan's Middle East initiative. Despite the reports from Jordan that seem to have buried the plan, Mr. Reagan and his top aides have been insisting for the last two days that the plan is wounded, perhaps, but not dead.

title: NORTHERN TRUST CO (CHICAGO) reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
PULTE HOME CORP reports earnings for qtr to Dec 31.
description: b-Includes a gain of $2,371,000, or 19 cents a share, from the sale of mortgage loan servicing by an unconsolidated subsidiary. Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split in December 1982.

title: Arafat to See Swede Today
description: Yasir Arafat, head of the Palestine Liberation Organization, will come here Tuesday for talks with Prime Minister Olof Palme of Sweden. Mr. Arafat is coming officially at the invitation of the Social Democratic Party, which is led by Mr. Palme.

title: Catholic Church Aide Sees Backing of Freeze
description: The Roman Catholic bishops' proposed statement on nuclear war will allow the American church to endorse a nuclear freeze resolution if it chooses, the head of the National Conference of Catholic Bishops said today.

title: NBI Moving To Campbell
description: NBI Inc. in Boulder, Colo., a maker of office automation equipment primarily for word processing, is moving its advertising account.

title: LATIN FOREIGN MINISTERS MEET TO REVISE PEACE PLAN
description: The Foreign Ministers of four Latin American countries met here today to revise a plan for achieving peace in El Salvador and halting fighting along the Nicaraguan-Honduran border.

title: Dollar Business Halted
description: The Midland Bank P.L.C. said today that it would transact no further dollar business in the Lloyd's of London insurance market because it did not want to comply with new regulations by Lloyd's covering dollar transactions.

title: PAINO RECITAL: RONALD KMIEC
description: RONALD KMIEC began a four-recital survey of Brahms's solo piano music last Friday night in Carnegie Recital Hall. This difficult project - four unusually long programs, this one including more than 30 separate items - demands the kind of technical security and tenacious memory that Mr. Kmiec could not muster Friday night.

title: News Analysis
description: The predominant assessment in Israel of the decision by King Hussein of Jordan not to start negotiations on the future of the West Bank was that the Government of Prime Minister Menachem Begin had been let off the hook.

title: A Golfer's Faith
description: Ben Crenshaw is a touring golf pro who prides himself on a historical knowledge of the game, especially the traditions and the layout of old courses. He says he enjoys the grand old courses in the metropolitan New York area, such as Shinnecock Hills, Baltusrol, Winged Foot and Quaker Ridge, more than newer courses around the country.

title: NEBULA THEORY BACKED
description: IT is becoming increasingly evident that a number of astronomical phenomena, such as the formation of planetary nebulae, are caused by interactions between two stars orbiting one another at such close range that their separate identities are difficult to observe. Last week it was announced that pairs of stars had been detected inside four such nebulae.

title: DEEP - SEATED CAUSES FOUND FOR TENDENCY TO DELAY
description: AT income-tax time, the procrastinators of the land seem to appear from everywhere. ''The cat ate my W-2 form'' and ''the cow died and I was in mourning'' are among the excuses of nearly three million people annually who postpone preparing their income tax returns until after the April 15 deadline.

title: VORNADO INC reports earnings for qtr to Jan 29.
description: b-Includes extraordinary credits of $750,000 for the quarter and $3,700,000 for the year. c-Net loss which is after losses from discontinued operations of $18,893,000 for the quarter and $62,437,000 for the year. Results for 1983 exclude $11,971,000 pre-tax of operating expenses charged to reserves for store closing costs and proceeds from sales of real estate assets credited to the reserve of $3,400,000 pre-tax. Results for 1983 include a pre-tax gain of $2,036,000 from the sale of marketable securities.

title: Herbert Brody, Leader Of Supermarket Chain
description: Herbert Brody, vice chairman and chief executive officer of the Supermarkets General Corporation, died yesterday at Overlook Hospital in Summit, N.J. He was 68 years old, and lived in Scotch Plains, N.J.

title: NORTH FORK BANCORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
Required Reading; Humpty Dumpty
description: The Rev. Richard C. Halverson, chaplain of the Senate, in opening prayer, April 5, 1983: Humpty Dumpty sat on a wall.

title: MINNEAPOLIS DESIGNER HITS THE BIG TIME
description: Recognition in the fashion world is not based solely on merit. The designer's social position, the prominence of his fans and the shock value of his clothes often have a role in catapulting an unknown into a style authority.

title: ANARCHIST UNIT IN GREEK ARMY IS SUSPECTED OF TERRORIST ACTS
description: The Greek Defense Ministry is trying to uncover an extreme leftist organization within the military believed to be responsible for a number of terrorist acts, according to ministry officials.

title: WYOMING RANCHERS REASSURED BY MX BASING PLAN
description: The proposal to base the MX missile in existing Minuteman silos in two Western states seems to have reassured ranchers and farmers who had been concerned that an earlier plan to deploy the missiles would disrupt land-use patterns and their rural way of life.

title: Fox Reports Profit in Period
description: Benefiting from revenues from the first showing of the movie ''Star Wars'' on cable television, the 20th Century-Fox Film Corporation today reported net income of $12 million for the quarter ended Feb.26.

title: U.S. Backs Jersey On Waste Cleanup
description: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency announced today its approval of New Jersey's four-year plan to clean up toxic waste sites, including 65 ranked by the E.P.A. as among the nation's 413 worst.

title: Correction
description: An editorial, ''Poorer, Hungrier,'' last Sunday incorrectly stated the number of children in two urban areas who die before their first birthdays. The correct figures are 33 out of 1,000 in some parts of Detroit, and 55 out of 1,000 in a section of Chicago.

title: SENATE DEMOCRAT DOUBTS REAGAN CAN GET PANEL SUPPORT TO RAISE MILITARY SPENDING
description: Senator Lawton Chiles of Florida, the ranking Democrat on the Senate Budget Committee, expressed doubt today that the White House could muster enough committee votes for an upward revision of the 5 percent increase in military spending approved by the panel last week.

title: MOSCOW'S ATTRACTIVE OFFER ON EUROMISSILES
description: To the Editor:

title: 7 TONS OF TOXIC WASTE VANISH IN FRANCE
description: Environmentalists and four Western European governments are trying to find out how 41 steel drums containing more than seven tons of industrial wastes, including the highly toxic dioxin, could virtually disappear in the heart of Europe.

title: Boat Racer Dies
description: A speedboat driver who suffered head injuries Saturday when his craft flipped out of control at 140 miles an hour died Sunday night. Barry Zenovka was ejected from his boat ''Instant Trouble'' during races on suburban Irvine Lake 35 miles southeast of Los Angeles. Zenovka was taken to Western Medical Center in Santa Ana and placed on life-support equipment.

title: VLSI TECHNOLOGY INC reports earnings for qtr to March 27.
EVACUATED FAMILIES RETURN HOME AS REGION'S RIVERS START TO RECEDE
description: Swollen rivers and flood waters began to recede and evacuated families returned to their homes yesterday after what had been the wettest of six rainy weekends in a row for the New York metropolitan area.

title: The Casinos' 2 Percent
description: New Jersey's law governing Atlantic City gambling requires casinos to reinvest at least 2 percent of their profits within the state. But the law is vague and inequitable, and so far New Jersey hasn't seen much in the way of reinvestment funds.

title: GENERAL PRODUCTION CO reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
INDIA BORDER IS NO BARRIER TO BANGLADESH MIGRANTS
description: The weathered low concrete pillars marking the boundary between India and Bangladesh are difficult to spot from the bumpy dirt road that runs along the frontier.

title: DNA's CODE: 30 YEARS OF REVOLUTION
description: JUST 30 years ago in Cambridge, England, two young men were in the grip of an idea so dazzling it was about to change the world. James D. Watson and Francis H.@C. Crick had discovered the structure of the master chemical of heredity of all living things. ''We wish to suggest a structure for the salt of deoxyribose nucleic acid (D.N.A.),'' they said in a brief letter that distilled the gist of their idea. The letter was published April 25, 1953, in the scientific journal Nature. It revealed to the world the nowfamous double helix structure of DNA.

title: PROGRESSIVISM FIGHTS FOR LIFE
description: PROGRESSIVE education, a powerful force early in the century for tailoring instruction in elementary and secondary schools to the needs of individual children, is now struggling to cope with the pressures of social and political conservativism.

title: Kahan Resigns Post With Convention Center
description: Richard A. Kahan, former president of the state's Urban Development Corporation, resigned yesterday from the board of the corporation that is building the city's Convention Center.

title: MARINE CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: The share earnings for all periods are adjusted for a 5 percent stock dividend paid earlier this month.

title: A Matter of Time
description: The Baltimore Colts hope to learn the fate of their backup quarterback, Art Schlichter, in time for the National Football League college draft on April 26. But Warren Welsh, the N.F.L.'s director of security, who is overseeing the investigation into Schlichter's gambling, is not making any promises.

title: UNITED BANCORP OF ARIZONA reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
TRANSDUCER SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to Dec 31.
description: b-Net income

title: AMERICAN RECREATION CENTERS reports earnings for qtr to Feb 23.
Western Air Picks Chief From Ranks
description: Western Airlines Inc., ending a three-month search, today picked a new president, Lawrence H. Lee, from within its ranks and unexpectedly gave him the title of chief executive.

title: Q & A
description: Q. Are there other parts of the world where tornadoes occur as frequently as in the central United States?

title: 11 AIDES WORKED ON PANEL ADVISING REAGAN ON ARMS
description: The President's Commission on Strategic Forces has 11 members and is headed by Brent Scowcroft, a retired Air Force general and former national security adviser.

title: NAHAMA & WEAGANT ENERGY CO reports earnings for qtr to Jan 31.
description: b-Net income including a tax credit of $127,000.

title: Books Of The Times
description: CHRISTINE. By Stephen King. 526 pages. Viking. $16.95. A POSSESSED car? An insanely angry 1958 Plymouth Fury named Christine that drives itself around attacking people? This time Stephen King has gone too far, I said to myself as I began to catch the drift of his eighth and latest horror novel, ''Christine.'' This time he's not going to get me the way he did in ''The Shining,'' ''The Stand,'' ''Cujo'' and his other maniacal stories. This time he's just going to leave me cold.

title: People
description: * Dale E. Landsman has been promoted to executive vice president/executive creative director at Marsteller Inc.

title:
PLAYERS;
MELANSON IS GETTING MAJOR PLAYOFF ROLE
description: The worst time each year for the professional existence of Roland Melanson just happened to be the most meaningful and exciting part of the hockey season. Just when the National Hockey League playoffs would begin and those lethargic Tuesday night skates with Winnipeg and Hartford and Detroit would end, Melanson would take his seat at the end of the Islander bench and watch the team attempt to add to its collection of Stanley Cups. His seat was one of the best, and perhaps the most unwanted, in Nassau Coliseum.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * American General Corp., Houston, elected F. Max Schuette senior vice president-operations.

title: THE DOLPHIN AS AN 'INCIDENTAL' CASUALTY
description: To the Editor:

title: HAMMERMILL PAPER CO reports earnings for qtr to March 27.
description: b-Including an extraordinary credit of $3,690,000, or 44 cents a share.

title: New Rioting in Brazil Protests Unemployment
description: Rioters rampaged through downtown Rio de Janeiro today, stoning cars and buses in a new outbreak of violent protests over unemployment and Brazil's economic crisis.

title: TUESDAY, APRIL 12, 1983
description: Markets

title: PENNSYLVANIA REAL ESTATE INVESTMENT TRUST reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
Pax in Bello Beaten at 1-20
description: Saverton scored a major upset by finishing 1 3/4 lengths ahead of the Kentucky Derby contender Pax in Bello, the 1-20 favorite, to win the $20,000-added Ian Chappell Handicap at Hialeah today.

title: MX PANEL PROPOSES BASING 100 MISSILES IN MINUTEMAN SILOS
description: A Presidential commission today recommended basing 100 MX missiles in existing Minuteman silos and proposed ''new directions'' for strategic forces and arms control through development of a new single-warhead missile for the 1990's.

title: Topics; Aprilled; Puddle-Wonderful
description: The circus elephants, who probably thought they were standing under the world's biggest hose, are said to have enjoyed last Sunday's 3.68 inches of rain. So did any number of small children with big boots.

title: School Budgets On Ballot in Jersey
description: Budgets in 551 of New Jersey's 611 school districts will be voted on Tuesday. ''It's hard to tell'' how many budgets will pass, said Marvin Reed, spokesman for the New Jersey Education Association.

title: PANELFAB INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for year to Nov 30.
description: b-Net loss.

title: House Resolution Expresses Sorrow Over Burton's Death
description: The House passed a resolution today expressing ''profound sorrow'' at the death of Representative Phillip Burton, Democrat of California.

title: LASER CRAFT INDUSTRIES reports earnings for year to Nov 30.
CONSUMER DEBT RISE IS SMALLER
description: Consumers took on $1.74 billion more in installment debt than they paid off during February, the smallest increase since last fall, the Federal Reserve Board said today.

title: CONROY INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
Austria Planning a New Farm For Lippizaners After Viruses
description: Agriculture Minister Gunter Haiden said today that Austria planned to set up a second farm to breed Lippizaner horses in an effort to reduce the danger of virus infections.

title: HIPOTRONICS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 5.
description: b-Net income.

title: SHUTTLE CREW STARTS NEW 3 - WEEK TASK
description: The Challenger's four astronauts met with their boss today and started three weeks of tests and interviews to record details of their flight in the new space shuttle.

title: Traveler's Diarrhea
description: As growing numbers of Americans seek vacation excitement in far-off and exotic places, traveler's diarrhea has become a matter of serious concern to tourists. Though rarely a cause of severe or incapacitating illness, traveler's diarrhea can certainly take the joy out of a vacation and limit the traveler's mobility for one to seven days.

title: SUN BANKS reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
NBD BANCORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
CPI CORP reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
VAN DYK RESEARCH CORP reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
Michael Ries, 65, a Manager Of Dance and Music Groups
description: Michael Ries, the senior vice president of Columbia Artists Management, died of cancer at his home in Manhattan Sunday. He was 65 years old.

title: Antilles Tied to Tax Evasion
description: A House subcommittee has uncovered evidence showing widespread use of the Netherlands Antilles for tax evasion by criminals and narcotics traffickers, as well as by business executives, committee and law enforcement documents show.

title: DESIGNATRONICS INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
description: Year-ago share earnings have been restated to reflect a 10 percent stock dividend declared in September 1982 and a 3-for-2 stock split declared in January 1983.

title: US HEALTH CARE SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
LANIER BUSINESS PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 25.
DR. SIDNEY LEVY
description: Dr. Sidney Levy, an early advocate of group practice by physicians, died of a heart attack Sunday in Bridgeport, Conn., on his way home from a family party in Massachusetts. He was 72 years old, and lived in Flushing Meadows, Queens.

title: NATIONAL CITY BANCORPORATION reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a nonrecurring gain of $645,000 from the sale of real estate.

title: MARRIOTT CORPORATION reports earnings for qtr to March 25.
description: b-Includes a gain of $2,400,000, or 9 cents a share, from the sale of Farrell's Restaurant division and interests in a Denver hotel.

title: Gold Futures Advance; Silver Prices Also Up
description: Gold futures prices advanced yesterday amid increasingly bullish short- and long-term market factors. Dealiers attributed the gains partly to an easing of short-term interest rates, which caused those who had sold gold and silver short last Friday to buy out of their positions yesterday.

title: The U.N. Today; April 12, 1983
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: A Costly Injury
description: James Worthy, the Lakers' high-scoring forward, broke his leg during the team's loss to the Phoenix Suns at Los Angeles Sunday night and will be out of action through the National Basketball Association playoffs. ''We've had some serious injuries this year, but this one hurts the most,'' said Worthy's teammate, Magic Johnson, echoing the sentiments of other Lakers.

title: KOCH IS STARTING NEW DRIVE TO CUT ILLEGAL PEDDLING
description: Mayor Koch announced another crackdown yesterday on illegal peddlers - those without licenses and those with licenses who operate in prohibited locations.

title: MURDOCK SEEMS VICTOR IN FLEXI-VAN STRUGGLE
description: David H. Murdock, the largest stockholder in the Flexi-Van Corporation, appears to have won control of the company after a brief fight with its management.

title: Thrift Unit Aided
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board took over the North Mississippi Savings and Loan Association of Oxford, Miss., which has assets valued at $150 million, after the Mississippi commissioner of savings associations asked a state court to appoint a receiver for the thrift unit. A spokesman for the bank board cited ''concern about the financial condition'' of the thrift unit.

title: CHAMBER: SATIE WORKS
description: NEARLY 60 years after his death, Erik Satie remains one of music's puzzle figures. How are we to reconcile the dada boulevardier, the composer of droll little works with titles like ''Trois Morceaux en Forme de Poire'' - Three Songs in the Form of a Pear - with the man who could create the haunting and profoundly serious symphonic drama ''Socrate''? The chamber ensemble Continuum, under the direction of Joel Sachs and Cheryl Seltzer, presented an ''Erik Satie Retrospective Concert'' in Alice Tully Hall last Saturday night and made a creditable stab at sorting through both the sublime and the ridiculous.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article Saturday on performances in the 18th annual workshop of the School of American Ballet incorrectly listed the number to call for tickets. It is 877-7635.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: BIG BRIDGE

title: GENERAL BUILDERS CORP reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Including extraordinary income of $260,000.

title: ROYAL BUSINESS GROUP INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 25.
description: b-Net loss. Share earnings figure for the latest 6 months is after the adjustment of net income for accumulated dividends of $64,000 on preferred stock. Results for 1982 include $80,000 of costs associated with the closing of a production facility.

title: THE LONG SEARCH FOR MX BASE PLAN
description: Development of the MX missile started in the Ford Administration when advances in Russian missile accuracy and explosive power were considered to have made United States missiles vulnerable to a pre-emptive, or first, nuclear strike.

title: L & N HOUSING reports earnings for qtr to Maech 31.
Spot Oil Price Is Firm
description: Crude oil prices firmed today on the spot European market as Saudi Light edged above the official $29 a barrel, traders said.

title: Ex-E.P.A. Chief's Aide Faces Colorado Inquiry
description: The grievance committee of the Colorado Supreme Court is investigating whether James W. Sanderson, an adviser to Anne McGill Burford when she was Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, violated the state bar's ethics code by taking part in agency matters affecting his clients.

title: AMERITRUST CORP OF CLEVELAND reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
AIDES SUED AT DEFUNCT THRIFT UNIT
description: The Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation yesterday sued the top officers and directors of the defunct New York and Suburban Federal Savings and Loan Association, accusing them of self-dealing and failure to manage the association prudently.

title: Boats Capsize; Oarsman Drowns
description: A freshman at New Hampshire drowned Sunday after he and 53 other members of the university's rowing club had been thrown into the rough waters of Great Bay by the capsizing of six sculls.

title: INTERNATIONAL INCOME PROPERTY INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
A LOBBYING FIRM SPECIALIZING IN BIPARTISANSHIP
description: In a suite of offices overlooking F Street in downtown Washington, an autographed Christmas greeting from former President Jimmy Carter hangs on the wall. Across the hall in an equally spacious office, a framed photograph with a personal message from President Reagan rests on a bookshelf.

title: BRIEFING
description: Airport Announcement

title: MAILBOX WARFARE
description: Here on narrow roads that meander through the fringes of suburbia, spring marks the beginning of open season on roadside mailboxes. Local youths bash them with baseball bats, knock them flat with cars, blow them up with powerful firecrackers and in one recent instance a battered, leaking mailbox was finished off with a bullet.

title: RECOMMENDATIONS FOR MX MISSILE PROGRAM
description: Following are excerpts from the report of the President's Commission on Strategic Forces that was submitted to President Reagan today: Deterrence and Arms Control

title: 5 Black Miners Arrested In South Africa
description: Five black miners were arrested today after workers refused to go underground and destroyed property at a uranium mine where 16 people died in an explosion last week, the South African radio reported.

title: TREBLE-DAMAGE LIMITS SUPPORTED
description: The Democrat who heads the House Judiciary Committee expressed general support today for an Administration plan to limit the treble-damage penalty for price-fixing to certain kinds of cases.

title: INNOVATOR IN CARING FOR AGED
description: Thomas R. Clarke, a specialist in nursing home and health administration who introduced concepts in the care of the elderly that encouraged self-reliance and reduced dependence on institutional treatment, died Friday at Mount Sinai Hospital after a long illness. He was 43 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: CONSOLIDATED PAPERS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
RSI CORP reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
UNITED TELECOMMUNICATIONS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
BANCTEXAS GROUP INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Includes an extraordinary tax credit of $1,026,000, or 5 cents a share. Year-ago results have been restated.

title: Court Removes Ban on Webster
description: Ben Webster received a court order yesterday temporarily allowing him to continue to train and drive horses at the Meadowlands. The harness track had sought to bar him as a result of evidence in a race-fixing trial.

title: INTERCO INCORPORATED reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.

Talking Business with Preston Martin of the Federal Reserve;
Central Bank's Complex Task
description: Wall Street's favorite indoor sport this spring is conjecture about who is going to be chairman of the Federal Reserve Board. Paul A. Volcker's term expires Aug. 6, and both he and President Reagan have been notably silent on the subject.

title: SOUTHTRUST CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
U.S. TAXPAYER, INC.
description: To the Editor:

title: RENT-CONTROL TENANTS MUST PAY RESIDENT INCOME TAX OR BE EVICTED
description: People with rent-controlled or rent-stabilized apartments in New York City who do not pay city income taxes at resident rates will face eviction, Mayor Koch said yesterday.

title: LANFRANCO RASPONI
description: Lanfranco Rasponi, a writer on society and the performing arts and a publicity agent for many prominent opera singers, died Saturday at his home in Rio de Janeiro.

title: METRO-NORTH STRIKE: 'PUNCHING HOLES IN A SINKING SHIP'
description: To the Editor:

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball

title: BUSINESS LEADERS WARY ON CHICAGO CONTEST ROLE
description: The Chicago business community, once a powerful force in city politics, is nearly as divided and impotent as the crippled Democratic machine in the heated mayoral race.

title: 'GANDHI' IS WINNER OF EIGHT ACADEMY AWARDS
description: In an evening devoid of surprises, ''E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial'' won most of the minor Academy Awards, and ''Gandhi'' won most of the major ones, including best picture, actor, director and screenplay.

title: A New Revenue Source?
description: The vending boxes that have sprouted for USA Today, the Gannett paper that started distribution in New York yesterday, have stirred plenty of interest around City Hall.

title: WITH THE BANKS, OFF THE BACK BENCHES
description: Senator Bob Kasten, who has defied President Reagan and Congressional leaders on the issue of tax withholding by bankse, is an unlikely rebel.

title: Profit Margins Off in Quarter
description: Manufacturers' after-tax profits dropped to 2.8 cents for every dollar of sales in the last three months of 1982, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Marathon Swim
description: Last year there were only 12 entries. But for this year's Manhattan Island Swimming Marathon on July 2, officials say, as many as 150 may take the plunge for the 27-nautical-mile competition around the island.

title: Officer Who Shot Black Faces No Suspension
description: The police chief said today that a white officer who shot an unarmed black man in the back Saturday night will not be suspended.

title: CHANCELLOR CONTENDER GIVES CONGRATULATIONS TO WAGNER
description: Dr. Thomas K. Minter, who had been a prominent contender for Chancellor of the New York City public school system, yesterday congratulated the candidate chosen for the job, Deputy Mayor Robert F. Wagner Jr., and pledged his cooperation.

title: Stiff Competition
description: In negotiating its new six-year television agreement with major league baseball, NBC had complained that competition from Saturday afternoon local telecasts had affected its national ratings. So as part of the new agreement, which takes effect next year, only NBC, cable-TV and pay-TV outlets can carry local games on Saturday afternoons.

title: Joseph Wechsberg, 75, A New Yorker Writer
description: Joseph Wechsberg, a contributor to The New Yorker and author of a dozen books on subjects ranging from music to contemporary history, died Sunday at his home in Vienna. He was 75 years old.

title: A Priest Is Accused Of Threatening Cooke
description: A Roman Catholic priest has been arrested and charged with threatening the life of Terence Cardinal Cooke and a bishop of the New York Archdiocese, the police said early this morning.

title: CONGRESSMEN SAY MX STILL FACES A TOUGH BATTLE
description: Lawmakers agreed today that a new proposal by a Presidential commission to base 100 MX missiles in existing silos on the Western plains had marginally improved the chances that Congress would approve deployment of the weapon. But the plan still faces a stiff fight on Capitol Hill.

title: RACE IS A MUTED ISSUE IN PHILADELPHIA
description: The setting was like many others in this city, an elevated transit stop beside a street of storefronts in a row-house neighborhood. The time was 7 A.M., and it was then and there that W. Wilson Goode began a day like many another in his race to become the city's next mayor.

title: Valvano to Nets?
description: Since Jim Valvano's North Carolina State basketball team won the national championship, and since Larry Brown quit his job as coach of the New Jersey Nets last week, there has been speculation that Valvano might be in line for the Nets' job. The club's chairman, Alan Cohen, said, ''No, we're not going after him,'' but then added, ''We feel it's too early to even talk about it because it might be construed as tampering.''

title: Nets Fine Richardson
description: In his first disciplinary action as the Nets' head coach, Bill Blair fined Michael Ray Richardson for missing practice today. The amount of the fine was not disclosed.

title: BLACKS AND CHICAGO
description: A black backlash that could affect the Democrats nationally is being widely predicted if Representative Harold Washington, the black Democrat who won a primary against two white candidates for Mayor of Chicago, loses in the election today to his Republican opponent, Bernard Epton. And one form such a backlash might take would be a black candidacy in the Democratic Presidential primaries.

title: IGNORED PREREQUISITE TO REAL ARMS CONTROL
description: To the Editor:

title: QUALITY CARE INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
description: b-Includes an extraordinary tax credit of $322,000 for the latest quarter and $126,000 for the year-ago quarter.

title: FAB INDUSTRIES CORP reports earnings for qtr to Feb 26.
REGULATORS WILL SUBMIT BILL ON FOREIGN LENDING
description: The Federal Reserve Board and other bank regulators said today that legislation placing restraints on American bank lending abroad was unnecessary but that they would go along with it if it was ''not unduly rigid or inconsistent.''

title: UNITED ARTISTS CORP reports earnings for qtr to Feb 24.
description: b-Net loss. The results for 1982 include gains of $500,000 for the quarter and $7,300,000 for the 6 months from the sale of tax benefits by Rogers UA Cablesystems Inc., a 49 percent owned affiliate. The results include gains from the disposal of properties of $190,000 for the latest quarter and $402,000 for the latest 6 months, and losses from the disposal of properties of $193,000 for the year-ago quarter and $210,000 for the year-ago 6 months. Share earnings and shares outstanding have been adjusted for a 100 percent stock dividend declared in January 1983.

title: Talks at 'Impasse,' Ravitch Says
description: Richard Ravitch, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, said yesterday that the latest union proposals in the Metro-North Commuter Railroad strike were only revisions of those made earlier. He said they would not give management the sole right to determine crew sizes, which it insists on having.

title: Still an Attraction
description: Even though Herschel Walker has abandoned Georgia football to become a pro, the Georgia-Florida game Nov. 5 in the Gator Bowl in Jacksonville, Fla., remains as great an attraction as ever. And buying any of the 28,000 tickets allotted to each school will be as difficult as ever, too.

title: TULTEX CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 5.
TV: OSCAR PRESENTATIONS, A COMPLEX PRODUCTION
description: MONDAY evening's Academy Awards presentation featured more hosts, more flubs and more shots of nervous nominees than any in recent memory. It began with glimpses of the downtown movie districts of cities such as Sydney and Tokyo, a display that probably made no less sense than the idea of having four hosts for the show. Nevertheless, Liza Minnelli, Dudley Moore, Walter Matthau and Richard Pryor all approached their duties as hosts gamely; Mr. Pryor even swung his arms suavely during the ill-advised musical introduction.

title: SEAL FLEET INC reports earnings for qtr to Dec 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: UNITED VIRGINIA BANKSHARES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
CBS INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-After a loss of $4.5 million from discontinued operations. Year-ago results have been restated to reflect the adoption of F.A.S.B. Statement No. 63, effective Jan. 1, 1983.

title: ABOUT NEW YORK
description: The fine weather is coming, the winds blowing off the Hudson River warming up and slowing down, and Maud Morris, known as Mother Morris to the building in which she lives and the church at which she prays, can sit outside again.

title: Kaiser Shows Wider Deficit
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation reported a deepening first-quarter loss today of $28.8 million, compared with a loss of $24.9 million last year. It said the results primarily reflected difficult circumstances facing its aluminum business during the period.

title: FIRST JERSEY NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Including income from securities transactions of $259,000 in the latest first quarter and $17,000 in the year- ago first quarter.

title: SOUTHEAST BANKING CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
WALGREEN CO reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
description: Share earnings have been adjusted to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split distributed on Feb. 11, 1983.

title: BALDWIN-UNITED'S BANKS AGREE TO DEBT STANDSTILL
description: The financially troubled Baldwin-United Corporation has signed a 93-day standstill agreement with its creditor banks, the company and bankers said yesterday.

title: Chrysler Prices Up
description: Prices on the Chrysler Corporation's vans and wagons were increased by as much as $122 in the past week, a company spokesman said. The price rises, ranging from $118 to $122, affect Dodge Ram vans, Ram wagons and Plymouth Voyagers shipped on or after April 4, according to the spokesman, who asked not to be identified. Prices for Chrysler vans start at $7,339, while wagon prices begin at $9,068.

title: McGee Still Ailing
description: It was back on March 28 that Willie McGee suffered a separation of his right shoulder when he ran into a fence during an intrasquad game.

title: BAIRNCO CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
A.M.C. Public Offering Raises $58.75 Million
description: The American Motors Corporation said its public offering of 10 million common shares was sold out early today for a total of about $58,750,000, just hours after being placed on the market on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: GENERAL INSTRUMENT CORP reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
MUSIC: JUILLIARD PLAYS MODERN WORKS
description: LIKE most string quartets, the Juilliard Quartet makes its living playing the great 18th-and 19th-century masterpieces; right now, the ensemble is engaged in a three-concert series at Carnegie Hall with each program devoted exclusively to a single great composer.

title: Miss Bassett, 14, Scores an Upset
description: Carling Bassett, the 14-year-old rookie pro, upset sixth-seeded Virginia Ruzici, 6-3, 7-6, today in the second round of the $250,000 Lipton women's tennis tournament.

title: Isuzu-G.M. Link
description: Isuzu Motors Ltd. said it had applied to the West German Government for approval to establish a joint venture with the General Motors Corporation to market Isuzu's trucks in Europe. The officials said Isuzu and G.M. hope to establish a joint venture, with the Japanese partner investing its capital in Continental Vehicle Sales Company, which is a West German subsidiary of G.M.

title: License Suspended For Exterminator
description: The State Department of Environmental Conservation suspended the license yesterday of a Long Island exterminating contractor accused of misapplying pesticides.

title: TARA EXPLORATION & DEVELOPMENT LTD reports earnings for year to Dec 31.
description: b-Includes a special gain of $3,151,000 from the waiving of loan interest and commitment fees. c-Net loss.

title: CARDINALS DEFEAT PIRATES IN 10th, 4-3
description: Keith Hernandez bowled over the catcher Tony Pena as he scored in the 10th inning to give the St. Louis Cardinals a 4-3 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates in the Pirates' home opener today.

title: Tribute to Pual Robeson
description: Sixty years ago this spring, Paul Robeson graduated from Columbia University Law School, but the racial discrimination he found in his profession moved him into music and politics.

title: KAISER ALUMINUM & CHEMICAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Revenue for the latest first quarter includes gains of $22.5 million from the renegotiation of natural gas contract rights and $22.2 million from the rebate of energy charges at the Chalmette plant.

title: PRODUCTS RESEARCH & CHEMICAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: Results include royalties of $466,000 and $847,000 for the 1983 quarter and 6 months respectively and $425,000 and $955,000 for the 1982 quarter and year respectively. Share earnings shares outstanding are adjusted for a 3-for-2 stock split declared on Feb. 9.

title: Strategy Of Hit-Run Pays Off
description: When a team pounds out 13 runs and 16 hits, as the Detroit Tigers did yesterday in spoiling the Yankees' home opener, it is difficult to remember a soft single. But to John Wockenfuss, the kind of hitand-run single that started a three-run sixth inning for the Tigers is what distinguishes him from most other hitters in the major leagues.

title: STAGE: 'SUS' EXPLORES AN INTERROGATION
description: UNDER a 150-year-old British law, repealed in 1979, a suspect could be held in police custody for 24 hours without being formally charged with an offense. Barrie Keeffe's play ''Sus'' (for ''suspect''), which opened Sunday night at the Hudson Guild Theater, deals with one such victim of police harassment. Coincidentally, the detention occurs on the night of Margaret Thatcher's election as Prime Minister.

title: Indonesian Oil Exports
description: The value of Indonesia's oil exports fell 18.25 percent in 1982 from 1981, according to preliminary statistics reported today by Bank Indonesia.

title: NOMINEE FOR U.S. ATTORNEY
description: It was a ''close decision,'' Rudolph W. Giuliani says, to give up the No. 3 post in the Justice Department and the national power, prestige and visibility that go with it.

title: Braniff Lenders Bar Hyatt Plan
description: The Braniff International Corporation's secured creditors have soundly rejected the Hyatt Corporation's proposal to revive the bankrupt airline, Braniff's chairman, Howard D. Putnam, said tonight.

title: WILLAMETTE INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to March 31.
description: b-Net loss.

title: Jury Recesses
